abstract.text: An animation that applies a spring-like force to a layer’s properties.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: You would typically use a spring animation to animate a layer’s position so that it appears to be pulled towards a target by a spring. The further the layer is from the target, the greater the acceleration towards it is.
allows control over physically based attributes such as the spring’s damping and stiffness.

You can use a spring animation to animation properties of a layer other than its position. The following code shows how to create a spring animation that bounces a layer into view by animating its scale from
. Because the spring animation can overshoot its
, the animated layer may exceed its frame.

abstract.text: Render, compose, and animate visual elements.
An interface that allows instances to respond to actions triggered by a Core Animation layer change.
The abstract superclass for animations in Core Animation.
Methods your app can implement to respond when animations start and stop.
An object that provides basic, single-keyframe animation capabilities for a layer property.
Defines the value the receiver uses to end interpolation.
An object that provides keyframe animation capabilities for a layer object.
Methods that model a hierarchical timing system, allowing objects to map time between their parent and local time.
An abstract subclass for creating animations that manipulate the value of layer properties.
An animation that applies a spring-like force to a layer’s properties.
Defines how the spring’s motion should be damped due to the forces of friction.
The initial velocity of the object attached to the spring.
The mass of the object attached to the end of the spring.
The estimated duration required for the spring system to be considered at rest.
The spring stiffness coefficient.
An object that provides an animated transition between a layer’s states.
An object that provides a flexible method of defining animated transformations.
A protocol that enables an object to be encoded and decoded for archiving and distribution.
A protocol that objects adopt to provide functional copies of themselves.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A protocol that enables encoding and decoding in a manner that is robust against object substitution attacks.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
A thread-safe type whose values can be shared across arbitrary concurrent contexts without introducing a risk of data races.
